intro: Erigeron candollei, commonly known as the Mexican fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Erigeron candollei is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
